.. index:: AssociatedLieAlgebra

.. _l4173736f6369617465644c6965416c6765627261:

AssociatedLieAlgebra(R, A)
==========================

:viewcode:`lie.spad line 1 <lie.spad#L1>` :editcode:`[edit on github] <lie.spad#L1>`

* R: \ :ref:`CommutativeRing <l436f6d6d7574617469766552696e67>`\ 

* A: \ :ref:`NonAssociativeAlgebra <l4e6f6e4173736f63696174697665416c6765627261>`\  R


AssociatedLieAlgebra takes an algebra \ ``A``\  and uses \ :spadfun:`*\$A`\  to define the Lie bracket \ ``a*b := (a *\$A b - b *\$A a)``\  (commutator). Note that the notation \ ``[a, b]``\  cannot be used due to restrictions of the current compiler. This domain only gives a Lie algebra if the Jacobi-identity \ ``(a*b)*c + (b*c)*a + (c*a)*b = 0``\  holds for all \ ``a``\ , \ ``b``\ , \ ``c``\  in \ ``A``\ . This relation can be checked by \ ``lieAdmissible?()\$A``\ .   If the underlying algebra is of type FramedNonAssociativeAlgebra(R) (i.e. a non associative algebra over \ ``R``\  which is a free \ ``R``\ -module of finite rank, together with a fixed \ ``R``\ -module basis), then the same is \ ``true``\  for the associated Lie algebra. Also, if the underlying algebra is of type FiniteRankNonAssociativeAlgebra(R) (i.e. a non associative algebra over \ ``R``\  which is a free \ ``R``\ -module of finite rank), then the same is \ ``true``\  for the associated Lie algebra.


.. _l4173736f6369617465644c6965416c6765627261-30:

\ :ref:`0 <l4162656c69616e4d6f6e6f6964-30>`\ \: % 
  from \ :ref:`AbelianMonoid <l4162656c69616e4d6f6e6f6964>`\

.. _l4173736f6369617465644c6965416c6765627261-636f65726365:

\ :ref:`coerce <l436f65726369626c65546f-636f65726365>`\ \: % -> A 
  from \ :ref:`CoercibleTo <l436f65726369626c65546f>`\  A


\ :ref:`coerce <l436f65726369626c65546f-636f65726365>`\ \: % -> \ :ref:`OutputForm <l4f7574707574466f726d>`\  
  from \ :ref:`CoercibleTo <l436f65726369626c65546f>`\  \ :ref:`OutputForm <l4f7574707574466f726d>`\ 


.. index::
   pair: AssociatedLieAlgebra; coerce

:spadfun:`coerce`\: A -> % 
  \ ``coerce(a)``\  coerces the element \ ``a``\  of the algebra \ ``A``\  to an element of the Lie algebra \ :ref:`AssociatedLieAlgebra <l4173736f6369617465644c6965416c6765627261>`\ (\ ``R``\ , A).

.. _l4173736f6369617465644c6965416c6765627261-636f6d6d757461746976653f:

  from \ :ref:`FiniteRankNonAssociativeAlgebra <l46696e69746552616e6b4e6f6e4173736f63696174697665416c6765627261>`\  R

\ :ref:`rightRankPolynomial <l4672616d65644e6f6e4173736f63696174697665416c6765627261-726967687452616e6b506f6c796e6f6d69616c>`\ \: () -> \ :ref:`SparseUnivariatePolynomial <l537061727365556e6976617269617465506f6c796e6f6d69616c>`\  \ :ref:`Polynomial <l506f6c796e6f6d69616c>`\  R if R has \ :ref:`Field <l4669656c64>`\  and A has \ :ref:`FramedNonAssociativeAlgebra <l4672616d65644e6f6e4173736f63696174697665416c6765627261>`\  R
  from \ :ref:`FramedNonAssociativeAlgebra <l4672616d65644e6f6e4173736f63696174697665416c6765627261>`\  R
